newsitem.title: HONG KONG: HK stocks slightly higher in choppy trading.
newsitem.headline: HK stocks slightly higher in choppy trading.

text.p: Hong Kong stocks were slightly higher on Tuesday morning in choppy trade, with profit-taking alternating with index futures-related buying, brokers said.
The Hang Seng Index added six points, or 0.05 percent, to 14,581 after moving between a record high of 14,618.36 and a low of 14,505.94.
"Buying is focused on a few big cap companies and this is probably related to derivatives trading," said Tony Yung, research director at Tai Fook Securities Co Ltd.
Futures traders were keen to push up futures ahead of the settlement on Thursday, brokers said.
